snippet: By ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, the study says, the Federal Housing Administration is imperiling borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.
abstract: Study of 2.4 million loans insured by Federal Housing Administration shows pattern of risky lending that could generate $20 billion in losses and harm thousands of nation's most vulnerable borrowers; says FHA, by ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, is imperiling borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.
lead_paragraph: By ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, the study says, the Federal Housing Administration is imperiling borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.

headline.seo: Study Shows a Pattern of Risky Loans by F.H.A.
headline.main: Study Shows a Pattern of Risky Loans by F.H.A.
headline.print_headline: Study Shows a Pattern of Risky Loans by F.H.A.
